message.content:
{"id": "49299", 
 "title": "Bug 49299 - Servlet 3.0 ch.7.1.1: Custom cookie name does not affect URL rewriting", 
 "description": "Chapter 7.1.1 of servlet30finalspec.pdf states that if a web application configures a custom name for its session tracking cookies, the same custom name will also be used as the name of the URI parameter if the session ID is encoded in the URL (provided that URL rewriting has been enabled). However, the actual result shows that the Reload link on the page still uses the default 'jsessionid' instead of the custom cookie name. A detailed description of the issue can be found in the attached WAR file.", 
 "OB": "The page sends the following cookie: SetCookie: MYSESSIONCOOKIE=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F; Path=/cookiename; HttpOnly. However, the Reload link on the page uses 'jsessionid' instead of the expected custom cookie name.", 
 "EB": "According to the statement in 7.1.1 of servlet30finalspec.pdf, the expected behavior is for the Reload link to use the custom cookie name in the URL, as follows: http://localhost:8080/cookiename/index.jsp;MYSESSIONCOOKIE=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F.", 
 "SR": "Please investigate the issue and ensure that the session ID is properly encoded in the URL using the configured custom cookie name, as specified in the Servlet 3.0 documentation."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '49299', 'title': 'Bug 49299Servlet 3.0 ch.7.1.1 says that custom cookie name affects URL rewriting', 'description': 'Bug 49299Servlet 3.0 ch.7.1.1 says that custom cookie name affects URL rewriting ', 'OB': 'Created attachment 25442 [details]cookiename.warIn chapter 7.1.1 of servlet30finalspec.pdf it is said that"If a web application configures a custom name for its session tracking cookies, thesame custom name will also be used as the name of the URI parameter if the sessionid is encoded in the URL (provided that URL rewriting has been enabled). Actual result:The page sends the following cookie:SetCookie: MYSESSIONCOOKIE=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F; Path=/cookiename; HttpOnlybut the Reload link on the page uses "jsessionid":http://localhost:8080/cookiename/index.jsp;jsessionid=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F4. ', 'EB': 'Expected result: if that phrase in 7.1.1 is to be followed, I would expect the Reload link to behttp://localhost:8080/cookiename/index.jsp;MYSESSIONCOOKIE=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F ', 'SR': ''}
